results.title: Princes Street Port Melbourne
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Lyn McLeavy and ACMI
results.brief_description: A tribute to a suburb, a family and a lady who liked to play the piano and sing the blues. Lyn McLeavey describes growing up in Port Melbourne in the 1950s, blending in the harsh realities of life as the daughter of a traumatised ‘wharfie’, with the simple joy of the sounds of the streets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Lyn McLeavy and ACMI
results.description: A tribute to a suburb, a family and a lady who liked to play the piano and sing the blues. results.title: Listen up my cherubs!
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Karen Milward and ACMI
results.brief_description: Energetic and intelligent, Karen Milward is constantly engaged with life. Often on the road for her work in the Aboriginal community, her children wonder what it is she actually does. This story is by way of explanation and gives insight into the life of an amazing community worker and consultant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Karen Milward and ACMI

results.title: About Oskie
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Norman Terrick and ACMI
results.brief_description: Norman Terrick believes he would not be the man he is today without his father. He lovingly describes a hard working man, who was good at what he did and always had time for his family. Even though he passed away in 1974, Terrick has created this tribute in memory of an inspiring man.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Norman Terrick and ACMI
results.description: Norman Terrick believes he would not be the man he is today without his father. He lovingly describes a hard working man, who was good at what he did and always had time for his family. Even though he passed away in 1974, Terrick has created this tribute in memory of an inspiring man.

results.title: My people
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Linda Kennedy-Baxter and ACMI
results.brief_description: Linda Kennedy-Baxter talks about her life through the people who have made it special, her family. Her family comes first and have taught her that its the little things that matter.

results.title: Why do they call me Rambo?
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Bindie Jack and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nicknamed ‘Rambo’ by his friends and named after his grandfather, a great fighter, Bindie Jack’s dad had hoped that Jack would follow in his pop’s footsteps. Jack has found an interest in fighting, just not exactly as his dad had intended.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Bindie Jack and ACMI
results.description: Nicknamed ‘Rambo’ by his friends and named after his grandfather, a great fighter, Bindie Jack’s dad had hoped that Jack would follow in his pop’s footsteps. Jack has found an interest in fighting, just not exactly as his dad had intended.

results.title: I love my family
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Amy Dowd and ACMI
results.brief_description: Amy Dowd has grown up in a big family but she wouldn’t have it any other way. She introduces us to them all, serving as a loving tribute and memoir for generations to come.

results.title: Kalihgat
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Terry Melvin and ACMI
results.brief_description: Terry Melvin recalls a cathartic event from his youth, when he travelled as a university student to India. In Calcutta, he worked in a hospice for the dying and destitute and tells of the experiences that have shaped and haunted the person his is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Terry Melvin and ACMI
